releases.body:

  • feat(storage): extend application schema for storage flag by @anvial in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/492
  • feat(storage): add storage support to application resource by @anvial in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/494
  • feat: conventional commits static analysis by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/509
  • fix: run provider tests in parallel by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/511

New Contributors

releases.body:
This is a second release candidate for the coming v0.13.0 release. For details about the planning and the dates for the release stages, please refer to the v0.13.0 release planning post.

What’s Changed

Refer to the changelog for the summary of the changes.

  • test: parallelize tests by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/515
  • fix(application): handle storage details conversion error by @anvial in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/525
  • Bump github.com/juju/clock from 1.0.3 to 1.1.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/510
  • chore(deps): bump github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-testing from 1.8.0 to 1.9.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/516

releases.title: 0.13.0-rc1
releases.body:
This is a release candidate for the coming v0.13.0 release. For details about the planning and the dates for the release stages, please refer to the v0.13.0 release planning post.

What’s Changed

Refer to the changelog for the summary of the changes.

  • Bug report enhancements. by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/478
  • chore(deps): bump golangci/golangci-lint-action from 4 to 6 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/479
  • chore(deps): bump github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-go from 0.22.1 to 0.23.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/480
  • chore(deps): bump github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-testing from 1.7.0 to 1.8.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/485
  • chore(deps): bump github.com/juju/charm/v11 from 11.1.0 to 11.2.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/487
  • chore(deps): bump github.com/bflad/tfproviderlint from 0.29.0 to 0.30.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/486
  • Bump goreleaser/goreleaser-action from 5 to 6 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/495
  • Bump github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-framework from 1.7.0 to 1.9.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/497
  • fix(application): allow both placement and constraints together. by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/499
  • Bump github.com/hashicorp/terraform-plugin-docs from 0.19.0 to 0.19.4 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/496
  • Use juju 3 5 1 by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/502
  • chore(deps): bump github.com/rs/zerolog from 1.32.0 to 1.33.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/490
  • fix: live discovery of data needed for juju by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/503
  • feat(storage): extend application schema for storage flag by @anvial in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/492
  • feat(storage): add storage support to application resource by @anvial in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/494
  • feat: conventional commits static analysis by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/509
  • fix: run provider tests in parallel by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/511
  • chore(release): update version and changelogs for 0.13.0-rc1 by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/513

New Contributors

  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/509
  • @wallyworld made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/pull/511

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/terraform-provider-juju/compare/rc0.12.0…0.13.0-rc1

This is a 3.x track release. It’s compatible with all the Juju controller versions up to 3.5.2.

What’s Changed

Enhancements

  • Add setuptools to tox.ini by @Aflynn50 in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1058
  • feat: conventional commits static analysis by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1068
  • feat(makefile): run .tox before lint in makefile target by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1069

Bug Fixes

  • fix parsing of storage constraints by @luissimas in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1053
  • fix(refresh): bug with revisions by @jack-w-shaw in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1067
  • fix(series): add noble support by @jack-w-shaw in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1063
  • fix zones constraints list parsing by @luissimas in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1054
  • fix(model): fix wrong instanciation of list-secrets facade by @gboutry in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1065

New Contributors

  • @luissimas made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1053

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/compare/3.5.0.0…3.5.2.0

What’s Changed

  • Make consume respect the controller name in the url by @Aflynn50 in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1038
  • Fix multiline description in textarea in bug template GH workflow by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1041
  • Fix issue with microk8s proxy by @Aflynn50 in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1044
  • add missing “revision” parameter to addModel step. by @Thanhphan1147 in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1043
  • Add user api to pylibjuju documentation by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1049
  • Release notes for 3.5.0.0 by @Aflynn50 in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1056

New Contributors

  • @Thanhphan1147 made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1043

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/compare/3.4.0.0…3.5.0.0

What’s Changed

  • Bugfix none type by @Aflynn50 in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1035
  • Fix deploy bundle tests by @jack-w-shaw in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1046
  • Release 2.9.49.0 notes by @Aflynn50 in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/1045

releases.title: v1.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Split up logger.go and writer.go. by @ericsnowcurrently in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/14
  • Support non-global loggers. by @ericsnowcurrently in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/13
  • Cleans up package abstractions by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/17
  • Protect write operations with a muxtex by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/18
  • Missing mutex in public method. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/19
  • Add a color writer and make it the new default. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/20
  • Move ANSI terminal color support into loggocolor by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/25
  • Adding the missing . in the comments ;) by @mohsen0 in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/26
  • Fix master by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/28
  • Add Parent and Child methods to the Logger type. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/30
  • Update docs. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/31
  • Add ability to set color capability on loggocolor by @makyo in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/34
  • Move ConfigureLoggers to the Context struct. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/36
  • Add ability to get Root logger from any Logger. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/38
  • Logger: Label loggers by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/40
  • Logging config for new loggers by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/43
  • Add GetLoggerWithLabels function by @hmlanigan in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/45

New Contributors

  • @ericsnowcurrently made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/14
  • @wallyworld made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/18
  • @mohsen0 made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/26
  • @makyo made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/34
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/40
  • @hmlanigan made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/loggo/pull/45

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/loggo/commits/v1.0.0

releases.title: v1.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • httptesting: fix for Go 1.6 by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/93
  • testing: remove deprecated AddSuiteCleanup function by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/94
  • add PatchExecHelper and CaptureOutput helpers by @natefinch in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/95
  • Fix PatchExecHelper.GetExecCommand on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/96
  • Handle the error return from utils.SetHome(). by @ericsnowcurrently in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/97
  • testing: add TCPProxy.CloseConns by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/98
  • mgo: don’t panic while resetting admin password by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/99
  • Don’t drop and recreate the database between tests by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/100
  • testing: don’t panic during TearDownTest if SetUpTest failed by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/101
  • Added BSONEquals checker by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/103
  • Detect mongod version before starting test server by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/104
  • lp:1596045 handle CRLF in mongo version line by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/105
  • copy clock from juju/juju/testing by @jrwren in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/106
  • Update to use the latest loggo. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/107
  • Retry mgo dial if unexpected message. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/109
  • Hook up mgo logging and reconnect properly. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/110
  • add NewProxiedSession by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/111
  • implement Clock.NewTimer by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/108
  • Bump mongo error output to 100 lines by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/112
  • Update testing.Clock to improve robustness by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/113
  • NewProxiedSession - ping to assign a socket to the returned session. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/114
  • checkers: ignore time zone in DeepEqual by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/115
  • MongoDB needs –key=value not –key value now by @dooferlad in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/116
  • Fixes for replicaset by @macgreagoir in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/117
  • Introduces a type which can be used to mock calls by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/118
  • tcpproxy: add pause and resume to the stream by @mhilton in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/119
  • Disable mgo logging/debugging by default by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/120
  • Mongo 3.4 uses a different string to indicate it is ready for connections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/121
  • Fix EchoQuotedArgsUnix/AssertEchoArgs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/122
  • Fix PatchExecutableAsEchoArgs on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/124
  • Prefer mongod 3.2 and improve mongod info caching by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/123
  • Default mongo storage backend to mmapv1 by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/126
  • Add MgoInstance.SSLEnabled method by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/125
  • Remove deprecated –sslOnNormalPorts arg to mongod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/127
  • Fix typo in mongo command by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/128
  • Stub check calls without order. by @anastasiamac in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/132
  • testing: default to mmapv1 only on x86(_64) by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/133
  • Don’t try to truncate the local replicaset oplog. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/135
  • Changes to support Mongo 3.6. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/136
  • Expose the version of Mongo that we are testing against. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/137
  • enable vendor as the highest priority import path by @ycliuhw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/138
  • Add short and long timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/139
  • Use juju/clock by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/140
  • Add the location of mongod in bionic to the list of places we look. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/141
  • Enable Mongo with Replica Sets by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/142
  • If using Replicaset use wiredTiger. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/143
  • Add support for finding the juju-db snap when looking for mongod by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/144
  • Allow testing of DoRequest against status code by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/145
  • Malformed errors by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/146
  • Fix address already in use detection. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/147
  • Move to go mod + fix juju-db snap usage by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/148
  • Fix issue with juju suites overwriting HOME by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/149
  • Sidestep HOME env var for juju-db snap testing by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/150
  • Add multi-checker by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/151
  • Add go style expressions for multichecker matching. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/152
  • Upgrade juju/utils package to v2 by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/153
  • Fix performance issue with using collstats. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/154
  • Only use mmapv1 args for mmap storage engine by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/155
  • Only use maxTransactionLockRequestTimeoutMillis for mongo 4 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/156
  • Update to use juju/mgo/v2 repo by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/158
  • Ensure that the namespaced collections in the logs db are removed during teardown. by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/160
  • Allow suites that depend on MgoSuite to disable cleanup. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/162
  • Update to use utils/v3 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/163
  • Upstream dep updates by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/164

releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Expose PruneTxns in order to allow external tools to use it by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/16
  • Add progress logging while pruning transactions by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/17
  • Retry errors that finish with ‘unexpected message’. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • Add export_test.go by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/19
  • Use mgo.Collection.Bulk to prune docs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/20
  • Add RunTransaction observer by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/21
  • Use disk-based pruning strategy by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/22
  • Make prune log output consistent by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/23
  • Cleanup txn.Stash as part of regular pruning by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • Cleanup all collections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/25
  • Don’t create transactions that have no operations. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/27
  • Abstract out “Completed Transaction” functionality by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/26
  • Properly test no-op does the right thing, as does real errors. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/28
  • Add a command-line utility to clean and purge txns. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • Add logging information about the pruning result. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/29
  • Turns out it isn’t safe to use aggregation in 2.4 at all. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/31
  • support using RemoveAll($in) instead of Bulk. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/32
  • Various cleanups by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/35
  • track what is actually removed by Oracle.RemoveTxns() by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/34
  • Expose a NewestTime for PruneOptions. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/36
  • Handle Bulk.Run() result being nil by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/37
  • When observing transactions include the run Duration. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/40
  • Change Clock back to being optional. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/41
  • Allow passing in a parameter to limit the number of transactions evaluated by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/42
  • Expose the batch size and number of batches. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/43
  • No need for uint64 and it makes default printing ugly by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/44
  • Use juju/clock package for the clock. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/45
  • Incremental prune by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/46
  • 2.4 prune options by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/47
  • Pass the transaction attempt by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • Revert “Merge pull request #48 from SimonRichardson/txn-attempt” by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/51
  • Add testing.SetFailIfTransaction. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/49
  • Retry i/o timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/52
  • Thread through the transaction by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/50
  • juju/txn with server side transactions by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/55
  • Add help text to explain why hooks do not run by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • Properly handle when RemoveAll returns an error. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/57
  • Use github.com/juju/mgo/v2 and convert to go mod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/58
  • Add extra txn backoff tuning parameters for sstxn by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/59
  • Make retry fuzz a percent and use durations instead of floats by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/60
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/61
  • Add support for no change log, used when upgrading to SSTXN. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

New Contributors

  • @howbazaar made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • @jameinel made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • @cmars made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • @timClicks made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • @hpidcock made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/txn/commits/v2.0.0

releases.body: Add support for cloning secret backend rotations to the –copy-controller option. See https://github.com/juju/juju-restore/pull/25 .

releases.title: juju-restore v0.13
releases.body: Add support for cloning secret backends to the --copy-controller option. See #24 .

releases.title: juju-restore v0.12
releases.body: Add a new --copy-controller option to initialise a new controller to look like a backed up controller. This is useful when setting up a controller for a newer Juju version and copying to that new controller users, clouds, and config from an existing controller. See #23.

Merge pull request #65 from SimonRichardson/charm-dependencies

https://github.com/juju/bundlechanges/pull/65

As the charm brings in dependency breaking changes (prefix for bundles are required), this ensures that all consumers of this library are fully exposed to the fact that the underlying charm and charmrepo changes are breaking changes and I’m forcing bundlechanges users to understand this.

The number of changes inside go mod and sum are a bit concerning, but all the tests pass, so I’m inclined to leave it as-is for now.

releases.title: 2.15.0 Support Pebble check-failed and check-recovered events
releases.body:
What’s Changed

This release adds support for new events based on Pebble checks. As of Juju 3.6b2, when a Pebble check reaches the failure threshold, a PebbleCheckFailedEvent will be emitted - and when the check starts passing again, the charm will get a PebbleCheckRecoveredEvent. Kubernetes charms can observe these events to react to failing checks - for example, change the unit or application status, output additional logging, or dynamically adjust the workload to work around the failure.

  • Add support for Pebble check-failed and check-recovered events in #1281

Fixes

  • Pass secret data to Juju via files, rather than as command-line values in #1290 fixing CVE-2024-41129
  • Include checks and log targets when merging layers in ops.testing by @amandahla in #1268

Documentation

  • Clarify distinction between maintenance and waiting status in #1148

CI

  • Bump the Go version to match Pebble in #1285
  • Run ruff format over charm pin update code in #1278
  • Bump certifi from 2024.2.2 to 2024.7.4 in /docs in #1282
  • Update charm pins in #1269

New Contributors

  • @amandahla made their first code contribution in #1268

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.14.1…2.15.0

releases.title: 2.14.1 Fix a possible Pebble exec hang and minor other fixes
releases.body:
What’s Changed

No new features with this release, but it includes a significant fix for Pebble exec to avoid hanging when Pebble is unable to respond quickly.

We’ve also corrected the Harness behaviour when working with secrets when the secret does not exist or the charm does not have permission to view/modify it, and also expanded the API reference documentation for secrets.

Fixes

  • Add connect timeout for exec websockets to avoid hanging in #1247
  • Adjust Harness secret behaviour to align with Juju in #1248

Tests

  • Fix TypeError when running test.pebble_cli in #1245
  • Properly clean up after running setup_root_logging in test_log in #1259
  • Verify that defer() is not usable on stop,remove,secret-expired,secret-rotate in #1233

Documentation

  • Fix HACKING.md link on PyPI, and internal links in #1236
  • Add a section to HACKING.md on PR titles (commit messages to main) in #1252
  • Add release step to update pinned charm tests in #1213
  • Add a security policy in #1266
  • Add ops.main to API reference in #1273

CI

  • Only run tests once on push to PR in #1242
  • Validate PR title against conventional commit rules in #1262
  • Only update ops, not all dependencies, in charm tests in #1275
  • Add artefact attestation in #1267

Thanks go to the members of the Canonical security teams who helped out putting the security policy together!

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.14.0…2.14.1

releases.title: 2.14.0 Fix RelationDataContent.update, add ActionFailed.__str__
releases.body:
This release fixes the RelationDataContent.update method to follow dict.update semantics, that is to allow another dict, an iterable, keyword arguments or a mixture thereof.

Features

  • feat: add a __str__ to ActionFailed, for better unexpected failure output in #1209

Fixes

  • The other argument to RelatationDataContent.update(...) should be optional by @addyess in #1226

Documentation

  • Use the actual emoji character rather than GitHub markup, to show properly on PyPI in #1221
  • Clarify that SecretNotFound may be raised for permission errors in #1231

Refactoring

  • Refactor tests to pytest style in #1206
  • Use ruff formatter and reformat all code in #1224
  • Don’t use f-strings in logging calls in #1234

New Contributors

  • @dimaqq made their first contribution in #1217. Thanks @dimaqq for your first contributions, and welcome to the team!
  • @addyess made their first contribution in #1226

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.13.0…2.14.0

commits.author: Jason Nucciarone
commits.message:
feat: enable juju-systemd-notices to observe snap services (#128)

  • fix: ruff -> ruff check

Original ruff $@ is no longer supported by latest versions of ruff

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • fix!: add support for observing snap services

Adds the watch.yaml file for configuring how the notices daemon observes services. The daemon will get the service alias from this file and use the alias to determine the proper hook to fire when the observed service is started or stopped.

BREAKING CHANGES: init for SystemdNotices now takes the Service data class instead of a generic list. The Service dataclass was added so that it would be easier to specify an alias for an observed service.

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • tests: update unit tests to reflect new notices API

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • tests: update integration tests

  • Consolidates metadata.yaml and actions.yaml into charmcraft.yaml for test charm. Less files to worry about.

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • docs: update lib documentation

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • chore(fmt): apply formatting rules

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • chore(lint): update copyright year

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • refactor: open -> write_text

yaml.dump() returns a string if steam is none, so it is easier to just pass the content off to write_text instead of opening the file with a context manager.

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • fix(tests): correctly patch filesystem on python 3.8

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • reactor: remove watch.yaml mechanism

  • Switch to passing the service names and aliases via argparse rather than using the pyyaml external dependency to create the watch.yaml file.

  • Use global map to track the observed service rather than caching the output of a watch.yaml read.

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • tests: update tests to not use watch.yaml

  • Reverted SystemdNotices in test charm back to the original constructor API.

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • fix(tests): remove pyfakefs as test dependency

  • Fixes unit tests failing on Python 3.10 due to incorrect patching.

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • refactor: remove explicit global references

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • docs: update example to use correct constructor arguments

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

  • chore: bump libpatch version

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

Signed-off-by: Jason C. Nucciarone nuccitheboss@ubuntu.com

commits.author: Guillaume Boutry
commits.message:
snap.py: fix snap.get optional key (#125)

Fix snap.get method to handle the case where the key is falsy. Treat it as no key provided, which results in the expected behavior to get all values from snap configs.

releases.title: v1.15.0: Identities, Go 1.22
releases.body:
This version adds support for the Pebble Identities features (described in OP043), and updates the Go version when building binaries and Snaps from Go 1.20 to Go 1.22.

What’s Changed

  • feat(state): core of reading/writing identities in state by @benhoyt in #428
  • feat(daemon): identities API endpoints by @benhoyt in #429
  • feat(client): Go client for identities by @benhoyt in #430
  • feat(cli): identities CLI commands by @benhoyt in #431
  • fix(snap): build snap with Go 1.22 to fix CVE-2024-24790 by @cjdcordeiro in #448
  • feat(daemon): use identities to auth API requests by @benhoyt in #434
  • chore: use Go 1.22 (supported), in go.mod and binary builds by @benhoyt in #449

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/pebble/compare/v1.14.0…v1.15.0

commits.author: Andrew Scribner
commits.message:
implement the essential startup and teardown functions of the charm (#4)

This implements the following basic function of the istio-k8s charm: * deploying istio from dynamically generated manifests using istioctl for a single configuration (ambient enabled, ztunnel on, istio CNI enabled, Gateway APIs included) * deploying the Gateway API CRDs * removing all deployed resources at charm removal

tags.body: build: bump version 0.3.5->0.3.6 (#53)

Gracefully handle empty remote app name (#35)

  • Gracefully handle empty remote app name

It shouldn’t ever happen but it seems that the remote app name can be set to blank during a relation-broken hook in some strange edge case which leads to a ModelError during SDI.__init__(). This handles that case more gracefully.

Fixes #34

commits.author: Daniela Plascencia
commits.message:
tests: use dex-auth svc DNS name as public-url (#1012)

For CKF 1.8, dex-auth and oidc-gatekeeper’s public-url config option can be set to http://dex-auth.kubeflow.svc:5556, this is because the whole authentication process is done internally in the cluster with dex-auth as an IdP and oidc-gatekeeper as an OIDC client.

releases.body:
Commits

  • 20e13a8: Filter targets with port and path (#120) (Robert Gildein) #120
  • b64f6cc: bump version to 0.4.3 (#122) (Robert Gildein) #122

Important changes

  • Getting relation data supports sides now and with this changes the assert_logging will break if Grafana agent app is provided. It’s need to be fixed by providing tested app instead of Grafana agent.
  • The deploy_and_assert_grafana_agent takes a new argument idle_period, which defined how long, in seconds, the agent statuses of all units of all Grafana agent need to be idle. This is important for Grafana agent to scrape for first time metrics, so we can see them in API. If your scrape interval is higher as default, you will need to increase this time.

Bug Fixes

  • remove assertion of BlockedStatus message (#105) #105 (Daniela Plascencia)

Continuous Integration

  • bump microk8s 1.25 -> 1.29 (#102) #102 (Daniela Plascencia)
  • use juju 3.4/stable instead of 3.5/stable (#103) #103 (Daniela Plascencia)

Chores

  • bump 0.4.0 -> 0.4.1 (#106) #106 (Daniela Plascencia)

Commits

  • db8340e: Add assert_grafana_dashboards function (#108) (Robert Gildein) #108
  • c8250d6: Check metrics endpoing with Grafana agent API (#110) (Robert Gildein) #110
  • e0bfe93: Get charm_name from charm metadata.yaml (#114) (Robert Gildein) #114
  • 09f0dd7: Add side parameter to get data from relation KF-5974 (Robert Gildein) #107
  • 86647b7: bump version to 0.4.2 (#112) (Robert Gildein) #112

What’s Changed

  • chore: fix rocks terminology by @cjdcordeiro in #96
  • Add cos-integration abstraction by @rgildein in #98
  • Bump version to 0.4.0 by @rgildein in #100

New Contributors

  • @cjdcordeiro made their first contribution in #96
  • @rgildein made their first contribution in #98

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/charmed-kubeflow-chisme/compare/0.3.0…0.4.0

commits.author: Manos Vlassis
commits.message:
Update scipy image and requirements for Charmed Kubeflow 1.9 (#92)

  • Update image, requirements.in, and requirements.txt

  • Update version of pydantic in kserve notebook

  • Update comments in requirements.in

  • Update image to v1.9.0

commits.author: Orfeas Kourkakis
commits.message:
fix(katib): Increase experiment batch-size (#93)

Increase experiment’s batch-size in order for the experiment to perform less training and thus complete earlier. The UAT’s role is to confirm that the controller works, rather than run a full experiment training.

Fixes canonical/katib-operators#211

commits.author: Manos Vlassis
commits.message:
Add section in README.md about testing on older versions of Charmed Kubeflow (#91)

  • Update requirements and image for UATS python 3.11 scipy 1.8 (#83)

  • Update requirements and image for UATS 1.8

  • Use requirements.txt in notebooks

  • Add a short section in README mentioning the different tracks

  • Correct version mistake in README.md

  • Update image, requirements.in, and requirements.txt

  • Revert “Update image, requirements.in, and requirements.txt”

This reverts commit 87b1fd3f0274bb509add683e75b80d22c69ce653.

Co-authored-by: Michal Hucko michal.hucko@canonical.com

releases.title: v1.15.0
releases.body:
1.15.0 (2024-08-08)

Features

  • add custom axios instance (722a331)
  • implement RolesService for the rebac module (8835e29)

Bug Fixes

  • add check for mock calls in DeleteRole (e9e3d54)
  • adjust logic for pagination (e852914)
  • annotate responses with the full type (1cd4b98)
  • use contextual tuples for admin role (37efc1e)
  • use contextual tuples to give admin access to all APIs (0e27337)

releases.title: v1.14.1
releases.body:
1.14.1 (2024-07-30)

Bug Fixes

  • allow UI port to be set (3da1b25)
  • remove login component from ui (51deb06)

releases.title: v1.14.0
releases.body:
1.14.0 (2024-07-19)

Features

  • actual link authentication users to authorization model + tests (8063b73)
  • handle case principal is not found in authorizer middleware + switch to CheckAdmin method (182e469)
  • introduce UserPrincipal and ServicePrincipal + move Principal structs and logic to ad hoc file + tests (69dbeb9)

Bug Fixes

  • set necessary oauth2 scopes as default (9c36e95)
  • set OtelHTTPClient in context correctly (e514b37)
  • ui redirection with context path (61451f6)
  • use contextPath to redirect to UI (8a7540d)

releases.title: v0.15.0
releases.body:
0.15.0 (2024-07-29)

Features

  • add settings flow (fcbd7ec)
  • handle missing webauthn credentials error (85979cd)
  • settings flow (d6770c8)
  • support account recovery (5fe26e5)
  • support mfa with totp method (16df279)
  • support passwordless webauthn method (ecfa6f4)
  • ui support for mfa flows (dc88e6b)

Bug Fixes

  • add client id to at aud (20fed79)
  • group -> parent/child relationship + add spaces for readability (da553c4)
  • handle invalid code case (bbfb9f1)
  • handle invalid recovery code case (wip) (c60343a)
  • pass cookie when creating settings flow to enable password change once logged in (0fc9bfc)
  • remove certificates from image (bfdd295)
  • remove unnecessary logging (f446110)
  • return to url with flow id (39d299c)
  • update docker compose (533a70c)

releases.title: v0.14.0
releases.body:
0.14.0 (2024-04-30)

Features

  • add error handling for login flow WD-10252 (f96567e)
  • return common errors to ui (5828a6a)
  • support password method (f8842f0)

Bug Fixes

  • fix path (e7ffc03)
  • password login method WD-10252 (1e98e09)
  • use relative path for callback (4aa6c83)

releases.title: v0.13.0
releases.body:
0.13.0 (2024-04-16)

Features

  • add success screen for device flow WD-10251 (e9b77db)

Bug Fixes

  • add device flow logic to hydra client (ca4a1f9)
  • add error handling to the device_code page (666f95b)
  • CheckAllowedProviders: fix OAuthKeeper case (24212f4)
  • implement device_code backend logic (06bb0b2)
  • pass error response from hydra to UI (b165f43)
  • typo in Oathkeeper name (5f7634d)
  • update device_code page (4ca0d13)
  • update hydra config (cb1e049)

releases.title: v0.1.0
releases.body:
0.1.0 (2024-07-30)

Features

  • add /groups endpoints handler (3295880)
  • add /resources endpoints (4470127)
  • add /roles endpoint handlers (070ad57)
  • add /swagger.json endpoint handler (41edd8a)
  • add Authenticator interface (dc45542)
  • add NewInvalidRequestError (9603f0c)
  • add NewNotImplementedError helper function (7eaf2a6)
  • add writeResponse func (8364b52)
  • add Capabilities endpoints handler implementation (6088299)
  • add Capabilities interface (8070618)
  • add capability inference (2720f22)
  • add CI linting and unittest run for rebac-admin-backend code (0435f5c)
  • add coverage for tests in reback-admin-backend folder (5f69042)
  • add Entitlements endpoints handlers implementations (52f4b15)
  • add Entitlements service interfaces (7cbd054)
  • add first handlers’ logic + scaffold remaining (c624cac)
  • add identities handler implementation for most endpoints (d4178dc)
  • add identitiesServiceBackend interface definition (7332476)
  • add implementation for /authentication/* endpoints (451a6cb)
  • add in-memory example (afbbbbb)
  • add initializers for custom errors + adjust test (c18938a)
  • add interfaces for IdentityProviders service (173789e)
  • add library composition/setup types (e26771d)
  • add new error creator functions (41d9736)
  • add new error function for authentication errors (cf024fa)
  • add PaginatedResponse generic type (a5acc87)
  • add Patch implementations, improved + missing tests (4984b3a)
  • add proper error formatting (63f5217)
  • add Roles related interfaces and error mapper (7b2e8e3)
  • add validation for /authentication endpoints (a91602c)
  • add validation for /groups endpoints (cff7f95)
  • add validation for /roles endpoints (8b4d008)
  • add validation to /identities endpoints (a41356a)
  • add ValidationError + adjust tests + godocs (e0f192e)
  • extend pull-spec.sh to allow for use of local file path (56e6795)
  • generate OpenAPI types/handlers (7d08230)
  • introduce ErrorResponseMapper interface and basic delegate implementation (a5fb259)

Bug Fixes

  • add /ready endpoint for testing (4fedc7b)
  • add content-type header to response (182580b)
  • add mocks target to Makefile (04a32db)
  • add NewUnknownError method (98b17fc)
  • add test target to Makefile (dee3d62)
  • add authentication middleware (8678565)
  • add helper methods to map/write service-level error responses (03b4a20)
  • add log on write response failure (f1e3700)
  • add preferred pagination parameter (451586d)
  • add public function ContextWithIdentity (b8c1a8f)
  • apply handlerWithValidation at composition (700d618)

commits.author: Claudiu Belu
commits.message:
Updates the nfsplugin rock (#8)

The nfsplugin executable currently fails because it has no /tmp folder. Additionally, it fails when it tries to open files in the mentioned folder, or when trying to listen to unix:///csi/csi.sock.

commits.author: Claudiu Belu
commits.message:
Sets entrypoint-service for rock (#6)

The NFS helm chart passes additional arguments to the container image, which should be passed to the binary itself. For this, we need to set the entrypoint-service, so Pebble will pass the arguments to the proper service.

commits.author: Claudiu Belu
commits.message:
Sets entrypoint-service for rocks (#10)

The NFS helm chart passes additional arguments to the container images, which should be passed to the binaries. For this, we need to set the entrypoint-service, so Pebble will pass the arguments to the proper service.

commits.author: Lucian Petrut
commits.message:
Update integration test (#3)

At the moment, the integration test is deploying the metallb chart without actually ensuring that the deployment succeeded.

We’ll add the appropriate assertions, as well as some necessary helm settings:

  • we’ll explicitly pass the container commands, bypassing Pebble.
    • Pebble cannot handle read-only filesystems. It attempts to write a file before starting the services and it hangs for 5 minutes before entering a restart loop if it doesn’t have write permissions.
  • we have to run the container processes as root
    • frr bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2147522
  • the chart version needs to be pinned, newer chart versions are not compatible with this image

While at it, we’ll set CGO_ENABLED=0 when building the metallb speaker as per the reference image, thus linking it statically.

releases.title: MicroK8s 1.30 released!
releases.body:
Featured in this release

Kubernetes 1.30 obviously

Read more at https://kubernetes.io/blog/2024/04/17/kubernetes-v1-30-release/

Dqlite stability

With the help of @miro-balaz we identified and patched a few issued that improve the reliability of our default datastore in resource limiting environments.

Important updates

Most notably - containerd to v1.6.28 and runc to v.1.1.12 - gpu-operator to v23.9.1

New addon

  • Stunner by @smeng9, a Kubernetes media gateway for WebRTC

In detail

What’s changed in detail

  • Do not set –hostname-override on kube-proxy when joining a cluster by @neoaggelos in #4360
  • Use build-snaps instead of manually installing the go snap by @IsaacJT in #4377
  • Bump containerd to v1.6.28 and runc to v.1.1.12 by @louiseschmidtgen in #4398
  • Fix erroneous microk8s join invocations by adding validation by @skatsaounis in #4397

External contributors

  • @IsaacJT made their first contribution in #4377
  • @skatsaounis made their first contribution in #4397
  • @miro-balaz rewrote the dqlite list query #83
  • @smeng9 contributed a new addon Stunner #223
  • @udit-uniyal addressed KubeArmor installation issue #216

releases.title: MicroK8s v1.29 released!
releases.body:
Featured in this release

“Quality of life” improvements

A lot of effort has gone into the datastore, DQlite. In this release we introduced the following improvements:

  • DQlite node role reassignment in case of failure domain availability changes
  • Optional admission control to ensure performance
  • Handling the out-of-disk-space cases
  • Performance improvements related to static linking of DQlite and SQL query preparation

New addons by our partners and community members

  • Falco: the cloud-native security tool that employs custom rules on kernel events to provide real-time alerts
  • CloudNative PG Operator: Leveraging cloud native Postgres for Kubernetes adds speed, efficiency and protection for your infrastructure modernization
  • ngrok: Ingress Controller instantly adds connectivity, load balancing, authentication, and observability to your services

Detail list of updates since last release

Kubernetes core services

  • Kubernetes 1.29

    Usability Improvements

  • Improved messaging in joining nodes

  • Fix the default IP shown in ‘microk8s add-node’ output when using FRR (thanks @nihr23)

  • Improve connectivity check in installers, thank you @smithyuk

  • Handle out of low disk capacity on dqlite nodes

  • Admission control to protect from dqlite performance degradation

  • Failure domain control plain datastore rebalance

  • Memory argument warning in installer, thank you @eddiesimeon

    Addon updates

  • New addon: nvidia, allows for enabling the gpu and network operators

  • New addon: Falco v3.7.1, thank you @jasonumiker

  • New addon: CloudNativePG, thank you @sxd

  • New addon: ngrok, thank you @russorat

  • Added default-class option to hostpath-storage, thank you @overtfuture

  • Upgraded sosivio to v1.7.1, thank you @DanArlowski

  • Upgrade linkerd to v2.14.3, thank you @balchua

  • Upgraded KWasm operator to version v0.3.0, thank you @0xE282B0

  • Upgrade keda to v2.12.0, thank you @balchua

  • Upgraded hostpath-storage to v1.5.0

  • Upgraded MICROCKS to v1.8.0, thank you @yada

  • hostpath-storage option not to be set as the default storage class, courtesy of @overtfuture

  • Removed ondat addon from the community repository

tags.body: build: bump version 0.3.5->0.3.6 (#53)

Gracefully handle empty remote app name (#35)

  • Gracefully handle empty remote app name

It shouldn’t ever happen but it seems that the remote app name can be set to blank during a relation-broken hook in some strange edge case which leads to a ModelError during SDI.__init__(). This handles that case more gracefully.

Fixes #34

commits.author: Claudiu Belu
commits.message:
Fixes the integration test (#7)

During the integration test, we’re cloning the SRIOV Network Device Plugin repository in order to deploy it.

However, it currently fails in the CI because we’re cloning it in the test instance, rather than cloning it locally. This results in FileNotFoundErrors because the files we’re trying to read to not exist locally.

This updates the integration test to clone the git repository locally, rather than in the test instance.

Adds velero plugin for vsphere rock and sanity test (#14)

Adds the rock for the mentioned velero plugin.

Note that we’re only building for amd64, since the plugin depends on VDDX libraries from VMWare, and there doesn’t seem to be support for arm64.

Added a sleep to the command so it doesn’t exit immediately. This way, Pebble respects the on-success / on-failure rules.

releases.title: v1.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Configure Renovate by @renovate in #1
  • Adding publish-lib workflow by @Gmerold in #3
  • Adds check libraries workflow by @saltiyazan in #4
  • Fixes a minor identation issue by @saltiyazan in #5
  • Removes the channel action and sets charmhub channel manually by @saltiyazan in #6
  • Adds workflow files for SDCORE ROCKs by @saltiyazan in #7
  • Update canonical/charming-actions action to v2.4.0 by @renovate in #8
  • [Feat] Adds option to enable metallb microk8s addon in integration tests by @gruyaume in #9
  • Dev adds GitHub to JIRA issue integration action by @saltiyazan in #10
  • Makes the workflow usable from different projects by @saltiyazan in #11
  • Update actions/checkout action to v4 by @renovate in #12
  • Adding metallb by @Gmerold in #13
  • Update docker/login-action action to v3 by @renovate in #14
  • Bumps LXD version to 5.17/stable by @Gmerold in #16
  • Enable auto-merging Renovate PRs by @Gmerold in #15
  • Archive charmcraft logs if publishing fails by @Gmerold in #18
  • Removing charmcraft logs from rock by @Gmerold in #19
  • Update issue template by @DanielArndt in #17
  • Update github/codeql-action action to v3 by @renovate in #20
  • Update actions/upload-artifact action to v4 by @renovate in #22
  • Update actions/download-artifact action to v4 by @renovate in #21
  • fix: Fixing promote workflow by @Gmerold in #23
  • feat: TELCO-948 Use variable for the track for charms by @markbeierl in #24
  • fix: Replacing specific version of the LXD snap with latest/stable by @Gmerold in #25
  • feat: Add workflow for integration tests with machine charms by @gruyaume in #26
  • feat: Adding workflow for Terraform module checks by @gatici in #27
  • chore(deps): update actions/checkout action to v4 by @renovate in #28
  • fix: Read metadata from charmcraft.yaml by @gruyaume in #29
  • chore: Rename the Terraform workflow file steps by @gatici in #30
  • fix: Adding working-directory as an input variable to the terraform workflow by @gatici in #31
  • chore: bump juju to 3.4 by @gruyaume in #32
  • chore(deps): update docker/login-action action to v3.1.0 by @renovate in #33
  • chore: replace renovate with dependabot by @gruyaume in #34
  • chore: add workflow for auto-merging dependabot prs by @gruyaume in #35
  • feat: Publish charms and snaps to branch on pull request by @markbeierl in #36
  • fix: Standardizing the integration tests so they all publish on push by @markbeierl in #37
  • chore: Sanitize branch name by @markbeierl in #38
  • chore: add pr title validation by @gruyaume in #39
  • fix: Sanitize underscore to dash by @markbeierl in #40
  • fix: add back missing pipe character by @markbeierl in #41
  • chore: add write permission to publish charm job for Dependabot by @dariofaccin in #42
  • fix: freeze lxd to 5.20/stable by @patriciareinoso in #43
  • fix: freeze lxd to 5.20/stable for all integration tests by @markbeierl in #44
  • fix: Use Canonical self-hosted runners for integration tests by @Gmerold in #46
  • chore: Going back to GH runners by @Gmerold in #47
  • fix: Fixing promotion workflow by @Gmerold in #48
  • feat: build charm in independent workflow step by @gruyaume in #45
  • chore: Allow promotion from beta to stable by @Gmerold in #51
  • chore: Adding update-libs workflow by @Gmerold in #52
  • chore: Adding option of checking out specific branch by @Gmerold in #50
  • fix: Changing default branch to github_ref reference by @Gmerold in #54
  • fix: Changing trigger from workflow_dispatch to workflow_call by @Gmerold in #55
  • chore: Enabling auto merge and auto approve for libs updates by @Gmerold in #57
  • chore: bump docker/login-action from 3.1.0 to 3.2.0 by @dependabot in #58
  • fix: Bumps version of the release-charm action to 2.6.0 by @Gmerold in #59
  • fix: Fixes charm publishing by @Gmerold in #61
  • chore: bump canonical/charming-actions from 2.4.0 to 2.6.0 by @dependabot in #63
  • chore: Approves the PR and enables auto-merge of libs regardless of the actor by @Gmerold in #64
  • fix: Adds pull-request-number to Auto approve step by @Gmerold in #66
  • fix: update workflow to use rockcraft.skopeo by @markbeierl in #67
  • chore: bump peter-evans/create-pull-request from 6.0.5 to 6.1.0 by @dependabot in #68
  • chore: bump canonical/charming-actions from 2.6.0 to 2.6.1 by @dependabot in #69
  • chore: bump canonical/charming-actions from 2.6.1 to 2.6.2 by @dependabot in #70
  • chore: Adds automerge label to PRs updating libs by @Gmerold in #71

New Contributors

  • @renovate made their first contribution in #1
  • @saltiyazan made their first contribution in #4
  • @gruyaume made their first contribution in #9
  • @DanielArndt made their first contribution in #17
  • @markbeierl made their first contribution in #24
  • @gatici made their first contribution in #27
  • @dariofaccin made their first contribution in #42
  • @patriciareinoso made their first contribution in #43
  • @dependabot made their first contribution in #58

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/sdcore-github-workflows/commits/v1.0.0

releases.title: Image 704af773157fa6c36e5123cf04cac5375971c691b1411ab76cded596e8131dd3
releases.body:
Released to ghcr.io/canonical/charmed-mysql:8.0.37-22.04_edge

What’s Changed

  • Add build artifacts for the MySQL OCI image by @shayancanonical in #1
  • Expose group replication port by @paulomach in #2
  • Implement MySQL server ROCK with rockcraft by @jardon in #4
  • Add xtrabackup Snap to ROCK by @jardon in #5
  • Fix initialization of mysqld by @jardon in #6
  • Sync GitHub issues to Jira by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #7
  • Pin sync_issue_to_jira workflow version by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #8
  • Convert base to snap from deb by @jardon in #9
  • Fix publishing branch filters by @jardon in #10
  • Cancel CI that is not the latest commit on a branch by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #11
  • Add licenses directory with the appropriate licenses by @jardon in #12
  • Add Foresight actions to CI by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #14
  • Add missing dependencies by @jardon in #16
  • Move container to ghcr by @jardon in #15
  • Fix retagging during build by @jardon in #17
  • Check version workflow by @jardon in #18
  • Update sync_issue_to_jira.yaml to v2 by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #19
  • Add missing package required by MySQL v8.0.32 by @shayancanonical in #20
  • Revert “Add Foresight actions to CI (#14)” by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #24
  • Remove cmd from rockcraft.yaml by @shayancanonical in #22
  • Create and chown log directory for mysqlrouter by @shayancanonical in #23
  • Create /etc/mysqlrouter directory by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #25
  • Update bug_report.md issue template by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #26
  • [DPE-2080] Generate dpkg manifest by @dragomirp in #27
  • Fix permissions for /home/mysql directory by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #28
  • Create /var/lib/mysqlrouter by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #29
  • Add mysql-shell python dependencies by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #30
  • [DPE-2137] Add SBOM generation by @dragomirp in #31
  • DPE-2221 DPE-2224 Rename version and dump only rock license into the image by @shayancanonical in #32
  • DPE-2424 Update rock version to 8.0.34 by @shayancanonical in #33
  • Add logrotate to the list of packages installed by @shayancanonical in #34
  • Update rock version to 8.0.35 by @shayancanonical in #37
  • Fix env var in sbom.yaml by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #38
  • Added badges to README by @a-velasco in #39
  • Update ROCK version to 8.0.36 by @shayancanonical in #40
  • Update rock version to 8.0.37 by @shayancanonical in #46
  • Build & release arm64 by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #42
  • Update data-platform-workflows to v17 by @carlcsaposs-canonical in #48

New Contributors

  • @shayancanonical made their first contribution in #1
  • @paulomach made their first contribution in #2
  • @jardon made their first contribution in #4
  • @carlcsaposs-canonical made their first contribution in #7
  • @dragomirp made their first contribution in #27
  • @a-velasco made their first contribution in #39

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/charmed-mysql-rock/commits/image-704af773157fa6c36e5123cf04cac5375971c691b1411ab76cded596e8131dd3

releases.title: v0.10.0
releases.body:
Highlights: this release adds support for a new top-level essential field in the slice definitions file. It also introduces a new Chisel command - find - for looking up slices in any given release, by package and/or slice name.

What’s Changed

  • refactor: filter created entries for report by @letFunny in #124
  • chore: bump golang.org/x/crypto to v0.21.0 by @rebornplusplus in #130
  • fix: parent directory permissions by @letFunny in #128
  • chore: add noble as separate github action by @letFunny in #132
  • feat: essential field for packages by @letFunny in #127
  • feat: support for several slices of the same package by @letFunny in #134
  • refactor: split slicer into steps and remove unnecessary state by @letFunny in #136
  • feat: report mutated files by @letFunny in #131
  • feat: add find command by @rebornplusplus in #99
  • chore: enable noble spread tests by @letFunny in #141
  • hotfix: use strings.TrimPrefix() for relative paths by @rebornplusplus in #145

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/compare/v0.9.1…v0.10.0

releases.title: v0.9.1
releases.body:
Highlights: this release fixes the constraint on the length of package names, now accepting packages with less than three characters in length.

What’s Changed

  • feat: creating files logs information for use in chisel.db by @letFunny in #105
  • fix(ci): adjust libc6 spread test for noble by @cjdcordeiro in #121
  • feat: add file and directory report skeleton by @letFunny in #116
  • remove deb package blob used for testing by @letFunny in #113
  • fix: package names can be of length two by @rebornplusplus in #120

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/compare/v0.9.0…v0.9.1

releases.title: v0.9.0
releases.body:
Highlights: this release introduces verification of GPG signatures for the Ubuntu archives’ InRelease files. This is also associated with an incoming change of format for the chisel-releases - this release now supports both chisel-v1 and v1 formats, noting that the former will soon be removed, in favour of v1.

What’s Changed

  • feat: integrity checks for Ubuntu Release files by @letFunny and @rebornplusplus in #106
  • feat: add support for chisel release format “v1” by @letFunny and @rebornplusplus in #115

Other minor changes

  • fix starlark link by @shyim in #110
  • make Spread tests run for multiple chisel-releases by @cjdcordeiro in #114

New Contributors

  • @shyim made their first contribution in #110

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/compare/v0.8.1…v0.9.0

tags.name: discourse-gatekeeper/base-content
tags.body: Use charmcraft.yaml instead of metadata.yaml

releases.title: v0.8.1
releases.body:
Fixed

  • Migration error where discourse is in-line with the default branch but the base content tag is behind. This no longer attempts migration and now also moves the tag to the latest commit on the default branch.

releases.title: v0.8.0
releases.body:
Added

  • Support for migrating the navigation table to the contents index
  • Checks that external references on the contents index return a 2XX response to HEAD requests

Fixed

  • Whitespace buildup between generated and input content

releases.title: v0.7.0
releases.body:
Added

  • Support for defining a contents index in the index.md file.
  • Support for hidden items on the contentx index.
  • Support for external items on the contents index
  • Automatically moving the discourse-gatekeeper/content tag when the documentation is up to date with discourse

Fixed

  • Navigation table not getting removed if the contents was hidden using the [details=...]...[/details] tag.
  • No longer use empty values from INPUT_COMMIT_SHA instead of reading the event/ environment
  • Removing leading and trailing whitespace in base content for comparison
  • Correct failing pre-flight checks due to shallowly checked out repos

commits.author: Mariyan Dimitrov
commits.message:
fix(starter): Rename JSON metadata files (#4)

The JSON metadata files require an .properties.json extension, so this commit renames the .json files to .properties.json.

In addition, I’ve moved the icons from a dedicated icons/ folder in the workflow-templates/ folder, as they need to be present here according to the doc at https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/creating-starter-workflows-for-your-organization

releases.title: Revision 123
releases.body:
resources:

Static resources: Released to ‘latest/edge’ at 08:50 UTC on 29 May 2024

What’s Changed

  • chore: apply new github bot for jira and gh sync and remove the old jira_gh sync action by @chanchiwai-ray in #185

New Contributors

  • @chanchiwai-ray made their first contribution in #185

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/charm-nrpe/compare/rev122…rev123

Breaking changes

  • COU now supports models deployed with Juju v3, dropping support for Juju v2 #451
    • NOTE: juju2 support was dropped because the expectation is that openstack deployments on juju2 will be upgraded to juju3 before upgrading openstack.

New features

  • support enable-auto-restarts=False for rabbitmq-server #413
  • new pre-upgrade steps to archive (#444) data from nova db.
  • initial unstable support for jammy/yoga to jammy/caracal upgrades #449

Bugs fixed

  • cou is frozen when juju action without parameters fails https://github.com/canonical/charmed-openstack-upgrader/issues/423
  • (performance improvement) using gather for wait_for_idle to wait for all application at the same time https://github.com/canonical/charmed-openstack-upgrader/issues/419
  • [ceph-mon] upgrade failed: hooks/update-status: No such file or directory https://github.com/canonical/charmed-openstack-upgrader/issues/465
  • (partially fixed by #435) Most of time cou unable to complete nova-compute upgrade because ceilometer-agent-compute is down after upgrade https://github.com/canonical/charmed-openstack-upgrader/issues/427

Full changelog: https://github.com/canonical/charmed-openstack-upgrader/compare/1.1.0…2.0.0

What’s Changed

This release gives support to plan and upgrade data-plane OpenStack applications. The cli now is able to accept different upgrade groups:

  1. control-plane
  2. data-plane
  3. hypervisors

For more information, please check the COU documentation

PRs

  • Preparation for OS app being frozen by @rgildein in #291
  • add global and func test concurrency by @rgildein in #301
  • Add add_steps function to BaseStep by @rgildein in #292
  • update codeowners to soleng by @rgildein in #308
  • Fix rich operators on OpenStackRelease by @gabrielcocenza in #307
  • Add env for idle timeout by @rgildein in #293
  • Aligning OS application names by @rgildein in #294
  • Add custom namespace for CLI arguments. by @rgildein in #295
  • Add dependent option to BaseStep by @rgildein in #296
  • Introducing Machine for OpenStackApplication by @rgildein in #298
  • Add sanity checks to app generate upgrade plan by @rgildein in #304
  • rename COUModel to Model by @rgildein in #318
  • Cleanup unittests by @rgildein in #319
  • Add function to set action-managed-upgrade by @rgildein in #320
  • Enhance clarity and consistency of step descriptions (#302) by @agileshaw in #321
  • Add Unit, Application and use them as base for OpenStackApplication object by @rgildein in #324
  • Add logic for step to raise HaltUpgradeExecution by @rgildein in #316
  • Merging the dev/data-plane to main by @rgildein in #328
  • Fix apps split between control-plane and data-plane by @gabrielcocenza in #341
  • Add data plane documentations by @agileshaw in #339
  • Add _check_ovn_support for ovn-chassis, ovn-central and ovn-dedicated-chassis by @rgildein in #331
  • Verify Hypervisors CLI input just for hypervisors machines by @gabrielcocenza in #342
  • Include WARNING level logs to STDOUT in default verbosity by @agileshaw in #340
  • Sanity check for ovn charms to check enable-version-pinning by @gabrielcocenza in #338
  • Add Swift application class by @agileshaw in #345
  • Fix enable and disable scheduler order on upgrade by @gabrielcocenza in #337
  • Fix missing machines for subordinate applications by @rgildein in #353
  • Add base structure for testing of statuses from real cloud by @rgildein in #334
  • Adjust RTD site header by @agileshaw in #354
  • Bypassing COUException in application raised during plan generation sanity checks by @agileshaw in #333
  • Add support for latest/stable by @gabrielcocenza in #347
  • Move _verify_channel to sanity checks by @rgildein in #358
  • Support OVN apps that don’t have “enable-versiong-pinning” config by @gabrielcocenza in #359
  • Update documentation to align with the current implementation by @agileshaw in #363
  • Ensure check version pinning execution for OVN charms by @gabrielcocenza in #367
  • Add CONTRIBUTING.md by @agileshaw in #366
  • Consider applications without origin setting to sanity checks by @gabrielcocenza in #364
  • Add log with OS app string representation to Analysis._populate by @gabrielcocenza in #371
  • Run sanity checks in HypervisorUpgradePlanner by @rgildein in #360
  • Add log to inform skipped(non-empty) hypervisors by @zxhdaze in #351
  • Increase Timeout by @gabrielcocenza in #377
  • Fix set_action_managed_upgrade by @gabrielcocenza in #378
  • Fix support for latest/stable for channel based apps by @gabrielcocenza in #372
  • Fix Hypervisor Upgrade by @gabrielcocenza in #379
  • Point to known-issues if COU execution fails by @gabrielcocenza in #383
  • Run update-status hook before checking workload version upgrade by @gabrielcocenza in #385
  • Raise ApplicationError on auxiliary channel_codename on invalid channel by @gabrielcocenza in #389
  • Add complex bundles on mocked_plans by @gabrielcocenza in #391
  • Add execution time of Applications and Hypervisors AZs by @gabrielcocenza in #394
  • Fix _verify_nova_compute by @gabrielcocenza in #397
  • Don’t check for mismatched versions if colocated with nova-compute by @gabrielcocenza in #398
  • Add new release and promote workflow by @rgildein in #402
  • Correctly set snap name to variable in promote.yaml by @dashmage in #405
  • Check possible charm downgrade when upgrading the channel by @gabrielcocenza in #392
  • current_os_release also consider OpenStack release set in configuration by @gabrielcocenza in #400

New Contributors

  • @zxhdaze made their first contribution in #351

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/charmed-openstack-upgrader/compare/1.0.1…1.1.0

commits.author: Gabriel Cocenza
commits.message:
Simplify the fetch exception on redfish (#79)

When any exception happens during redfish fetch the metric redfish_call_success is set to 0 that will trigger Prometheus alerts.

commits.author: Gabriel Cocenza
commits.message:
Ignore if redfish fails to logout (#78)

  • Igonore if redfish fails to logout with 401 as as response

Redfish sometimes fails to logout after scraping the data and this end up generating the metric redfish_collector_failed that trigger prometheus alerts that can be noise.

This can be a BMC problem that might not be properly closing sessions.

For more info see: https://github.com/DMTF/python-redfish-library/issues/160

Closes: #76
